dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So, GameStop plummeted over the last quarter—what does that say about the whole meme stock phenomenon?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, GameStop plummeted over the last quarter-what does that say about the whole meme stock phenomenon?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's wild that hedge funds actually made massive gains from shorting it, right? I mean, retail investors were supposed to be fighting them, but here they ended up betting the same way.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's wild that hedge funds actually made massive gains from shorting it, right? I mean, retail investors were supposed to be fighting them, but here they ended up betting the same way.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Retail investors gave severe nose bleeds to hedge funds which built short positions in GameStop. A lot of this was chiefly due to the fact that retail traders took opposite bets against hedge funds.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and uh, institutional investors like those backing AMC or PLTR just ignored retail trends and still came out on top. It feels like the little guy never stood a chance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and uh, institutional investors like those backing A M C or P L T R just ignored retail trends and still came out on top. It feels like the little guy never stood a chance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Most of these names were not top picks among institutional investors, but retail traders backed them up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's Tesla ditching Bitcoin—Elon Musk selling all their holdings, which just crushed their stock and customer interest. Talk about a flip-flop.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's Tesla ditching Bitcoin-Elon Musk selling all their holdings, which just crushed their stock and customer interest. Talk about a flip-flop.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nevertheless, it will not be changing that digital currency back into fiat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he basically sided with traditional bankers, which is the last thing you'd expect from him. But what about SPACs? They took a nosedive too—hardly any new ones formed, even celebs avoided them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he basically sided with traditional bankers, which is the last thing you'd expect from him. But what about SPACs? They took a nosedive too-hardly any new ones formed, even celebs avoided them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Special Purpose Acquisition Companies (SPACs), also known as blank-check companies, became increasingly popular during the first quarter of 2021. We have had 250+ SPACs so far this year, and celebrities and sports personalities are backing them up as sponsors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Serena Williams stayed away, Cathie Wood shunned them… but then you have Archegos Capital, which the SEC praised for conservative leverage? That seems contradictory.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Serena Williams stayed away, Cathie Wood shunned them... but then you have Archegos Capital, which the S E C praised for conservative leverage? That seems contradictory.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Investors like Cathie Wood, from ARK Investment Management LLC, also bought a SPAC with tennis star Serena Williams on the board.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Totally, and they got extensions from big banks like Credit Suisse while making huge returns on Tencent Music and ViacomCBS. Meanwhile, regular investors are getting squeezed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally, and they got extensions from big banks like Credit Suisse while making huge returns on Tencent Music and ViacomCBS. Meanwhile, regular investors are getting squeezed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The family office was forced to sell its tech positions in media companies such as Tencent Music, ViacomCBS, Discovery and Baidu. Shares of these companies plunged, and this also made banks like Credit Suisse issue grave profit warnings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then Biden cancelling the stimulus package because the economy was "doing too well"? Stocks hit historic lows in March—so much for that theory.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then Biden cancelling the stimulus package because the economy was doing too well? Stocks hit historic lows in March-so much for that theory.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. President Joe Biden signed another coronavirus-related stimulus package of $1.9 trillion, which has armed traders with fresh capital. One thing that is clear from this is that U.S. stock indices have closed the quarter, and the month of March, at an all-time high.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, German air taxi startup Lilium collapsing in a $3.3 billion SPAC failure… it feels like retail money has lost all its power now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, German air taxi startup Lilium collapsing in a three point three dollars billion S P A C failure... it feels like retail money has lost all its power now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: German Air Taxi Startup Lilium To List In $3.3 Billion SPAC Merger The key point to keep in mind is that we can no longer discount the strength of retail money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure, forums like Wallstreetbets might become irrelevant if regulators get lax with family offices and leverage. That could really harm the whole system.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure, forums like Wallstreetbets might become irrelevant if regulators get lax with family offices and leverage. That could really harm the whole system.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The SEC is likely to adopt a tougher stance on family offices to avoid any systematic risk to the financial system. We may likely see the social forums such as Wallstreetbets picking up momentum.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And both parties agreeing on tax hikes? Another round of austerity is gonna keep the market stagnant. Retail traders just don't have the funds to bounce back.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And both parties agreeing on tax hikes? Another round of austerity is gonna keep the market stagnant. Retail traders just don't have the funds to bounce back.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So, it is essential to keep in mind that while Democrats may support all the infrastructure spending such as building new bridges, airports and upgrading the internet infrastructure, Republicans aren't likely to nod their heads for a tax hike.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a tough landscape—feels like the rules of the game are shifting away from the everyday investor again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a tough landscape-feels like the rules of the game are shifting away from the everyday investor again.

artist_script:
HostA: So, GameStop plummeted over the last quarter—what does that say about the whole meme stock phenomenon?
HostB: Yeah, and it’s wild that hedge funds actually made massive gains from shorting it, right? I mean, retail investors were supposed to be fighting them, but here they ended up betting the same way.
HostA: Exactly, and uh, institutional investors like those backing AMC or PLTR just ignored retail trends and still came out on top. It feels like the little guy never stood a chance.
HostB: And then there’s Tesla ditching Bitcoin—Elon Musk selling all their holdings, which just crushed their stock and customer interest. Talk about a flip-flop.
HostA: Right, and he basically sided with traditional bankers, which is the last thing you’d expect from him. But what about SPACs? They took a nosedive too—hardly any new ones formed, even celebs avoided them.
HostB: Yeah, Serena Williams stayed away, Cathie Wood shunned them… but then you have Archegos Capital, which the SEC praised for conservative leverage? That seems contradictory.
HostA: Totally, and they got extensions from big banks like Credit Suisse while making huge returns on Tencent Music and ViacomCBS. Meanwhile, regular investors are getting squeezed.
HostB: And then Biden cancelling the stimulus package because the economy was "doing too well"? Stocks hit historic lows in March—so much for that theory.
HostA: Plus, German air taxi startup Lilium collapsing in a $3.3 billion SPAC failure… it feels like retail money has lost all its power now.
HostB: For sure, forums like Wallstreetbets might become irrelevant if regulators get lax with family offices and leverage. That could really harm the whole system.
HostA: And both parties agreeing on tax hikes? Another round of austerity is gonna keep the market stagnant. Retail traders just don’t have the funds to bounce back.
HostB: It’s a tough landscape—feels like the rules of the game are shifting away from the everyday investor again.
